title.narrative: Prepositioning of support to floods victims in Rwanda

description.narrative: This project will prioritize the following actions, based on lessons learned from previous years as well as analysis of the predicted impact of flooding: 1. Food and Non Food Items (NFIs): Prepositioning of critical strategic stockpiles - food and NFIs such as shelter materials, clean and accessible energy for cooking, dry storage access points for supplies. This intervention will ensure that the flood victims have access to the basic means of survival. Each food parcel will contain: 40kg maize flour, 5liters cooking oil, 10kg beans. Non Food Items (NFIs) kits will contain: 1 blanket, 10 sheets metals, 2 kg galvanised wire, 1 cooking set, 1 cooking stove, 1 mattress. 2.Water Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) Interventions: Preposition of WASH items due to the high risk of contamination to water sources which would lead to a further crisis, including the spread of water -borne diseases. This intervention will minimise the public health risks and will facilitate victims' access to clean drinking water, basic hygiene and sanitation. WASH kits include: 1 bucket/ baison, 1 jerry can, 1 packet soap, 1 handwashing kit. 3.Early warning awareness: This includes early warning messaging and awareness campaign particularly in high risk areas (at risk population in rural/ isolated communities focusing more on the most vulnerable population of concern including women, youth, children and people with disabilities) to compliment messaging through Radio, TV, and newsletters and social media by Rwanda Meteorology Agency; awareness campaign on Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) (targeting more on women and youth as change agents in DRR). This project component will ensure wide preparation of the targeted population in the implementation of disaster risk reduction measures and behaviours during the crisis.
